intro: Canthium amplum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are clustered in complex structures called cyathia, which are surrounded by bright yellow bracts. Canthium amplum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
